required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Brief Title: Study of Efficacy and Safety of Canakinumab as Adjuvant Therapy in Adult Subjects With Stages AJCC/UICC v. 8 II-IIIA and IIIB (T>5cm N2) Completely Resected Non-small Cell Lung Cancer Acronym: (None)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Multicenter, Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo-controlled Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of Canakinumab Versus Placebo as Adjuvant Therapy in Adult Subjects With Stages AJCC/UICC v. 8 II -IIIA and IIIB (T>5cm N2) Completely Resected (R0) Non-small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of the study is to compare the efficacy and safety of canakinumab versus placebo as adjuvant therapy in adult subjects with stages AJCC/UICC v. 8 II -IIIA and the subset of IIIB (T>5cm N2 disease) completely resected (R0) non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Disease Free Survival (DFS) by local investigator
primary_outcome.description: DFS will be assessed from the time from the date of randomization to the date of the first documented disease recurrence as assessed by local investigator radiologically or death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.description: Overall Survival (OS) is the time from the date of randomization to the date of death due to any cause.
To compare lung cancer specific survival in the canakinumab arm versus placebo arm

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum concentration-time profiles of canakinumab and appropriate individual PK parameters based on population PK model
secondary_outcome.description: To characterize the pharmacokinetics of canakinumab therapy
To characterize the prevalence and incidence of immunogenicity (anti-drug antibodies, ADA) of canakinumab

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to definitive 10 point deterioration symptom scores of pain,cough and dyspnea per QLQ-LC13 questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the effect of canakinumab versus placebo on PROs (EORTC QLQC30 with QLQ-LC13 incorporated and EQ-5D) including functioning and health related quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to definitive deterioration in global health status/QoL, shortness of breath and pain per QLQ-C30 together with
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the effect of canakinumab versus placebo on PROs (EORTC QLQC30 with QLQ-LC13 incorporated and EQ-5D) including functioning and health related quality of life

arm_group.description: Participants will be administered receive canakinumab for 18 cycles (approximately 54 weeks).
Participants will be administered receive canakinumab placebo for 18 cycles (approximately 54 weeks).

intervention.description: Canakinumab will be administered periodically for approximately 54 weeks.
Placebo will be administered periodically for approximately 54 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written informed consent must be obtained prior to any screening procedures
- Subjects must have recovered from all toxicities related to prior systemic therapy to grade ≤ 1 (CTCAE v 4.03). Exception to this criterion: subjects with any grade of alopecia and grade 2 or less neuropathy are allowed to enter the study
- ECOG performance status (PS) of 0 or 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with unresectable or metastatic disease, positive microscopic margins on the pathology report, and/or gross disease remaining at the time of surgery
- Subjects who received neoadjuvant chemotherapy or neoadjuvant radiotherapy
- Presence or history of a malignant disease, other than the resected NSCLC, that has been diagnosed and/or required therapy within the past 3 years Exceptions to this exclusion include the following: completely resected basal cell and squamous cell skin cancers, and completely resected carcinoma in situ of any type.
- Known active or recurrent hepatic disorder including cirrhosis, hepatitis B and C (positive or indeterminate central laboratory results)
- Subjects with a history of tuberculosis (TB) infection, active or latent, or one of the risk factors described in the protocol
- Subjects with suspected or proven immunocompromised state as described in the protocol
- Live vaccination within 3 months prior to first dose of study drug

clinical_study.keyword: AJCC/UICC v. 8 stages II-IIIA and IIIB (T>5cm N2)

patient_data.ipd_description: Novartis is committed to sharing with qualified external researchers, access to patient-level data and supporting clinical documents from eligible studies. These requests are reviewed and approved by an independent expert panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations. This trial data will be available according to the process described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com.
